org.modelio.gproject.fragment

Interface IProjectFragment

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFragment, ExmlFragment, MdaFragment, RamcFileFragment, UnsupportedFragment, UrlFragment

    public interface IProjectFragment
    Represents a fragment of the project.

    A project fragment may contain model elements and files. Its content may be available locally or be located on a distant server. A fragment must be mounted in order for its content to be accessible.

    This interface should not be directly implemented. Please extends AbstractFragment instead.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String PROP_READ_ONLY
      Property that tells the fragment is read only.

    • Field Detail

      • PROP_READ_ONLY

        static final String PROP_READ_ONLY
        Property that tells the fragment is read only.

        This property must be supported by all fragment implementations.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        void delete()
     throws IOException
        Delete the fragment from the disk.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the fragment could not completely be removed from disk.

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns:
        the fragment identifier.

      • getType

        FragmentType getType()
        Get the fragment type identifier.

        The fragment type is used on persistence to determine the fragment class to instantiate.

        Returns:
        the fragment type.

      • getUri

        URI getUri()
        Get the project mount URI.
        Returns:
        the mounted URI or null if not mounted.

      • mount

        void mount(GProject project,
           IModelioProgress aMonitor)
        Mount the fragment so that it is usable.
        Parameters:
        project - the project where the fragment is mount.
        aMonitor - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.

      • unmount

        void unmount()
        Release all resources allocated by the fragment.

      • getProperties

        GProperties getProperties()
        Get the fragment specific properties.

        The available properties are implementation dependent.

        Returns:
        the fragment properties.

      • getRepository

        IRepository getRepository()
        Returns:
        the model repository

      • getRoots

        Collection<MObject> getRoots()
        Get the root elements of the fragment.
        Returns:
        the root elements of the fragment.

      • getState

        FragmentState getState()
        Get the state of the fragment.
        Returns:
        the fragment state.

      • getDownError

        Throwable getDownError()
        Get the error that caused the fragment to be in the down state.
        Returns:
        the down state cause.

      • getScope

        DefinitionScope getScope()
        Get the fragment definition scope: local or shared by a server.
        Returns:
        the fragment scope.

      • reconfigure

        void reconfigure(FragmentDescriptor fd,
                 IModelioProgress aMonitor)
        Reconfigure the fragment from the given descriptor.

        The given fragment will have the same ID and type. It may have a different URI. The fragment may choose to update, unmount and remount or even to remove itself and install a new one.

        Parameters:
        fd - the new fragment configuration
        aMonitor - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.

      • getAuthConfiguration

        GAuthConf getAuthConfiguration()
        Get the fragment authentication configuration if needed. May be null.
        Returns:
        authentication data.

      • setDown

        void setDown(Throwable error)
        Set the fragment in "down" state, with the cause.

        Fires a FRAGMENT_DOWN event.

        Parameters:
        error - the cause of down state

      • migrate

        void migrate(GProject project,
             IModelioProgress aMonitor)
      throws FragmentAuthenticationException,
             IOException
        Migrate the fragment if needed.
        Parameters:
        project - the project where the fragment would be mount.
        aMonitor - the progress monitor to use for reporting progress to the user. It is the caller's responsibility to call done() on the given monitor. Accepts null, indicating that no progress should be reported and that the operation cannot be cancelled.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of failure
        FragmentAuthenticationException - in case of authentication failure

      • getMetamodelVersion

        VersionDescriptors getMetamodelVersion()
                                throws IOException
        Get the fragment metamodel versions.
        Returns:
        the fragment metamodel versions.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of I/O failure reading the version
